record.title: EXTENDING AUTHORITY OF SECRETARY OF EDUCATION
record.narrative:
EXTENDING AUTHORITY OF SECRETARY OF EDUCATION -- (Senate - September 17, 2008)

[Page: S8960]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of H.R. 6889, which was received from the House.

record.chair: The clerk will report the bill by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (H.R. 6889) to extend the authority of the Secretary of Education to purchase guaranteed student loans for an additional year, and for other purposes.
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the bill.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the bill be read three times and passed, the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table, with no intervening action or debate, and any statements related to the bill be printed in the Record.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The bill (H.R. 6889) was ordered to a third reading, was read the third time, and passed.
